docs.lead_paragraph: 10 P.M. (Sundance) FULL FRONTAL FASHION The Sundance Channel begins its twice-yearly tribute to New York Fashion Week with seven nights of sartorial-theme programming. First is ''The Day Before,'' a new documentary series from the director Loïc Prigent (''Signé Chanel'' and ''Marc Jacobs & Louis Vuitton'') that follows final preparations for runway presentations by four high-profile fashion houses. The series begins with Sonia Rykiel (above, seated at center), a k a the Queen of Knits, as her family-owned company gears up to celebrate its 40th anniversary in Paris. Other episodes focus on Fendi (Thursday), Proenza Schouler (Friday) and Jean Paul Gaultier (Saturday). ''Somebody Told Me About ... Carla Bruni,'' at 11, looks at the model and singer, and features a cameo from her husband, President Nicolas Sarkozy of France. 7 A.M. (ABC) GOOD MORNING AMERICAPresident Obama is interviewed. Darius Rucker and Lee Ann Womack announce the Academy of Country Music Awards nominees.
docs.snippet: 10 P.M. (Sundance) FULL FRONTAL FASHION The Sundance Channel begins its twice-yearly  tribute to New York Fashion Week with seven nights of sartorial-theme programming. First is ''The Day Before,'' a new documentary series from the director Loïc...

docs.lead_paragraph: In his speech to Congress at 8 p.m. Wednesday,President Obama will press his case for major health care legislation, not just with lawmakers in the audience, but also with a deeply wary public watching at home.
docs.abstract: President Obama will press his case for major health care legislation, not just with lawmakers in the audience, but also with a deeply wary public watching at home.
docs.snippet: President Obama will press his case for major health care legislation, not just with lawmakers in the audience, but also with a deeply wary public watching at home.

docs.lead_paragraph: The future of Senator Max Baucus's compromise health care proposal is far from certain, but one industry group was quick to fire back on Tuesday. The protest came from makers of medical devices like heart pacemakers and artificial hips - companies that would have to pay hefty new fees under the Baucus plan.

headline.main: Medical Device Makers Oppose New Fees in the Baucus Plan

docs.abstract: Makers of medical devices are not happy with the $4 billion in annual fees that the Baucus plan would levy on them.
docs.snippet: Makers of medical devices are not happy with the $4 billion in annual fees that the Baucus plan would levy on them.

docs.lead_paragraph: Our colleagues at The Caucus blog report that President Obama and Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. met with the House speaker, Nancy Pelosi, and the Senate majority leader, Harry Reid, on Tuesday afternoon to discuss renewed efforts to forge consensus on a health care overhaul. According to the Times reporter Jeff Zeleny, Mr. Obama "urged the leaders not to abandon the prospect of achieving a bipartisan consensus, but said if that couldn't be done, the Democrats would proceed on their own."

headline.main: Obama Meets With Pelosi and Reid on Health Care Push

docs.abstract: Top Congressional Democrats met with President Obama on Tuesday afternoon.
docs.snippet: Top Congressional Democrats met with President Obama on Tuesday afternoon.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama met privately in the Oval Office on Tuesday afternoon with the top two Congressional leaders and renewed his pledge to achieve an overhaul of the nation's health care system this year, a goal that will require Democrats to bridge a considerable gulf inside their party over the scope and shape of the legislation.
docs.abstract: After a White House meeting with the Democratic Congressional leaders, Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she believed a public insurance option was critical to House passage of a health care bill.
docs.snippet: After a White House meeting with the Democratic Congressional leaders, Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she believed a public insurance option was critical to House passage of a health care bill.

docs.lead_paragraph: At 8 p.m. Wednesday, President Obama faces what may prove to be a defining moment in his presidency. He must convince Americans, many of them deeply skeptical, that they should overhaul the nation's health care system.

headline.main: What Should Obama Tell You About Health Care?

docs.abstract: The president will try to convince Americans that an overhaul of health care is necessary. What do you feel you need to hear?
docs.snippet: The president will try to convince Americans that an overhaul of health care is necessary. What do you feel you need to hear?

docs.lead_paragraph: The No. 2 Democrat in the House reaffirmed Tuesday that the proposal for a government-run insurance plan could be dropped from the major health care legislation under consideration in Congress.

headline.main: Hoyer Says Public Plan Could Be Dropped

docs.abstract: Following conflicting signals from House leaders, many Democrats will be looking to President Obama's speech on Wednesday for direction on the public option.
docs.snippet: Following conflicting signals from House leaders, many Democrats will be looking to President Obama's speech on Wednesday for direction on the public option.

docs.lead_paragraph: After days of controversy, President Obama heads to suburban Virginia on Tuesday to deliver an address to schoolchildren on the importance of an education.

headline.main: The Early Word: Back to School

docs.abstract: Students returning to school may hear from President Obama, while Congress returns to resume work on health care bills.
docs.snippet: Students returning to school may hear from President Obama, while Congress returns to resume work on health care bills.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the anniversary of some of the most spectacular failures in our economic history approaches, we are no closer to finding a way to manage the failure of a large financial firm, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in his latest DealBook column.

headline.main: A Breakdown on Handling Big Failures

docs.abstract: As the anniversary of some of the most spectacular failures in our economic history approaches, we are no closer to finding a way to manage the failure of large financial firm, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in his latest DealBook column.
docs.snippet: As the anniversary of some of the most spectacular failures in our economic history approaches, we are no closer to finding a way to manage the failure of large financial firm, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in his latest DealBook column.

docs.lead_paragraph: As Congress returns to Washington Tuesday, with health care atop the agenda, a handful of lawmakers - besides the party leaders, of course - are particularly worth watching.

headline.main: The Lawmakers Who Bear Watching as Congress Returns

docs.abstract: As Congress returns to Washington Tuesday, with health care atop the agenda, a handful of lawmakers - besides the party leaders, of course - are particularly worth watching.
